text:
The lenders had got done an independent valuation of Kingfisher House, once the headquarters of Vijay Mallya’s airline, and a leading real estate consultant had pegged the value at Rs. 40-50 crore. The suggested valuation was, however, discarded by the lenders who set the reserve price at Rs. 150 crore.

Another leading property consultant said the reserve price was too high, given the area and the current market trends.

“There were no bidders. I think the higher reserve price was the reason. Lenders will now meet on March 19 to review the reserve price,” said a source, adding that the bankers were looking to lower it to Rs. 100-120 crore.— PTI
title: Lenders’ high reserve price proves damper at auction
